DOC.detailed_description: Background : Research suggest smoker receive treatment inside hospital post-discharge follow least month likely quit smoke n't receive intervention . The current challenge know best way support patient post-discharge Brazilian context . Objective : The aim study compare effectiveness motivational interview ( MI ) plus Personalized text message ( TM ) usual care outpatient , focus smoke cessation main outcome . Methods : All patient admit University Hospital Juiz de Fora ( HU/UFJF ) , 06/2015 01/2016 , ask cigarette consumption last 30 day . Smokers patient receive brief intervention nicotine replacement therapy hospitalization . After hospitalization discharge smoker allocate intervention control arm . The intervention group receive MI session telephone mobile phone TM twice day eight fifteen day . The control group receive usual care available inside hospital . Results : At first third month , randomization , patient contact smoke abstinence assessment .
